default: a {@filter martial melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;melee weapon} of your choice
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

optionalfeature.name: Skirmishing
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls you make with weapons with the thrown property.
Also, drawing a thrown weapon may be done as part of each attack you make with them during your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Open Up
entries: Until the end of your next turn, the next attack you or an ally makes against your target is made with advantage. You expose your target's defenses.

optionalfeature.name: Outmaneuver
entries: Until the end of your next turn, your target's attacks against you are made with disadvantage. You can't use this exploit while wearing heavy armor. You dismantle your target's offense.

optionalfeature.name: Apprehend
entries: You may make a grapple or shove attempt against that target. Additionally, until the end of your next turn, that enemy can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Tethers
entries: All damage dealt by your attack becomes force damage and you may force the target of your attack to make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, that enemy suffers the penalties of a {@spell slow} spell until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Unnerve
entries: Until the end of your next turn, your target has disadvantage on concentration checks, can't make reactions and can't benefit from advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Roll
entries: You can move up to half your speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

optionalfeature.name: Agitate
entries: Your target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, that enemy is {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Canny Defense
entries: Some seekers choose to dodge incoming attacks deliberately, using forethought and prediction rather than agility. At 1st level, as long as you're not wearing heavy armor, you may add your Intelligence modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier to your AC. If you wear medium armor, the maximum bonus is restricted as normal.
If you have a negative Dexterity modifier, it is applied as a penalty to your AC even if you add your Intelligence modifier this way.

classFeature.name: Eclectic
entries: Also at 1st level, either from learning or from experience, you have gained extensive insight about the world around you. You choose between gaining proficiency with two tools, learning two languages of your choice, or one of each. You can't learn exotic languages through this feature.

classFeature.name: Keen Observation
entries: You have learned the value of paying close attention to detail. You can use the {@action Search} action as a bonus action.
Additionally, you add your Intelligence modifier as a bonus to  Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By the time you reach 2nd level, your cunning has granted you the ability to reshape reality, allowing you to cast spells. Your spells are discoveries that you can innately exploit. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the {@filter ranger spell list|spells|class=ranger}.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Seeker table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell alarm} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell alarm} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the seeker spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Seeker table shows when you learn more seeker spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the seeker spells you know and replace it with another spell from the seeker spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your seeker Spells, since your cunning allows you to fully control the arcane energies. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a seeker spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a two-handed or versatile melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

entries.name: Skirmishing
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls you make with weapons with the thrown property. Also, drawing a thrown weapon may be done as part of each attack you make with them during your turn.

classFeature.name: Improvisation
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can adapt your tactics, feinting to predict your foes patterns and get the upper hand. Once during your turn, when you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum one). You regain all uses of this ability once you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Seeker's Pursuit
entries: At 3rd level, you begin specialized training to achieve your pursuit from the list of available pursuits. Your choice grants features at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 18th level.

entries.name: Pursuit Spells
entries: Each pursuit has a list of spells—its pursuit spells—that you gain at the seeker levels noted in the pursuit description. Once you gain a pursuit spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.
If you have a pursuit spell that doesn't appear on the seeker spell list, the spell is nonetheless a seeker spell for you.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Exploit Opening
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you exploit the gaps in you find in your enemies' defenses. When you hit a creature twice with weapon attacks during your turn, your second attack deals an additional {@dice 1d8} damage and you can perform an exploit. A list of available exploits can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=EO:S} page. You have three such exploits: {@optfeature Open Up|secretwizard}, {@optfeature Outmaneuver|secretwizard} and an option determined by your pursuit.
At 9th level and then again at 13th and 17th levels, the additional damage dealt by this feature increases by {@dice 1d8}, to a maximum of {@dice 4d8} at 17th level.

classFeature.name: Tireless
entries: Starting 7th level, you gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws. Additionally, if you are suffering from {@condition exhaustion}, you treat it as one level less, unless your level of {@condition exhaustion} would cause you to die.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Exploit Opening (2d8)
entries: Starting at 9th level, the extra damage dealt by your Exploit Opening feature increases to {@dice 2d8}.

classFeature.name: Pursuit feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Seeker's Pursuit.

classFeature.name: Seize the Chance
entries: At 11th level, when you hit an enemy twice with weapon attacks during your turn, you can use your bonus action to make an additional weapon attack against that creature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Exploit Opening (3d8)
entries: Starting at 13th level, the extra damage dealt by your Exploit Opening feature increases to {@dice 3d8}.

classFeature.name: Prodigy
entries: At 14th level, you can effortlessly comprehend new concepts and technical abilities. If you spend 1 hour listening to a language, other than a secret language such as Druidic, you learn it. If you spend 1 hour interacting with a tool within reach, you gain proficiency with it.

classFeature.name: Flash of Genius
entries: At 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no uses of Improvisation left, you regain one use.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Exploit Opening (4d8)
entries: Starting at 13th level, the extra damage dealt by your Exploit Opening feature increases to {@dice 4d8}.

classFeature.name: Pursuit feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Seeker's Pursuit.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Masterstroke
entries: At 20th level, when you use your Seize the Chance feature, you can use your bonus action to make two additional weapon attacks against that creature, rather than one.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodhound
entries: You hone your skills to be able to track and capture individuals—dead or alive. The abilities you develop while following this pursuit are well-suited for bounty hunters, detectives, constables or watchers—focusing on take downs, tracking and snaring.

subclassFeature.name: Sleuth
entries: As you enter this pursuit at 3rd level, you develop methods to find and capture your marks. You have advantage on Charisma checks to gather information and on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to attempt to grapple or shove a target.

subclassFeature.name: Arrester's Exploit
entries: At 6th level, your attacks allow you to lock your enemies down. You gain the {@optfeature Apprehend|secretwizard} exploit.

subclassFeature.name: No Escape
entries: Starting at 10th level, there's no escaping your grasp. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to follow tracks. While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.
Additionally, you count as one size larger for the purpose of grapple or shove attempts you make.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Force
entries: Starting at 18th level, you become relentless in your search. You have advantage on saving throws against effects that would make you {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified} or {@condition stunned}, and you are immune against effects that would reduce your speed.

subclassFeature.name: Keymaster
entries: Keymasters are keepers of ways—those who connect spaces in the ether to provide access to occult dimensions, and also those who are tasked with shutting down those pathways. Planar explorers, rift wardens and far travelers are among those who exploit these abilities to manipulate the fabric of space and time itself.

entries.caption: Keymaster Pursuit Spells
rows: {@spell magic circle} (you may also choose aberrations when using this spell)
{@spell hallow} (this spell also affects aberrations), {@spell teleportation circle}

subclassFeature.name: Detect Portal
entries: As you enter this pursuit at 3rd level, you gain the ability to magically sense the presence of a planar portal. As an action, you detect the distance and direction to the closest planar portal within 1 mile of you. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Riftwalk
entries: At 3rd level, you have a pool of planar energies that you can expend to slink into the ether which replenishes when you take a long rest. With this pool, you can teleport up to a number of feet equal to 20 x your seeker level.

As a bonus action, you can expend a number of feet from your pool to teleport up to that distance to an unoccupied space you can see. The maximum amount of feet you may spend this way on a single use is 10 feet per seeker level.
For example, a 4th level seeker would have a pool of 80 feet to spend, but could only spend up to 40 feet on a single bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Warp Exploit
entries: At 6th level, your attacks can latch onto the ether essence of your targets. You gain the {@optfeature Ethereal Tethers|secretwizard} exploit.

subclassFeature.name: Detect Interlopers
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can perceive the presence of interplanar creatures. As an action, you know the location of any of the following types of creatures with 120 feet of you: {@filter aberrations|bestiary|type=aberration}, {@filter celestials|bestiary|type=celestial}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter fey|bestiary|type=fey}, {@filter fiends|bestiary|type=fiend}, or {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead}. This also reveals which of those creatures are present and their numbers.

subclassFeature.name: Doorway
entries: Starting at 18th level, you master your abilities to create dimensional pathways. You can use this ability to cast {@spell plane shift} or {@spell teleport} by spending 100 feet from your Riftwalk pool.

subclassFeature.name: Cultist
entries: There are those whose ambition and curiosity drives them to seek the teachings of ancient, eldritch beings that defy logic and reason. These occultists risk their sanity to find the knowledge they crave, and in doing so, learn the forbidden secrets of the abyss.

subclassFeature.name: Method to Madness
entries: At 3rd level, you've learned to have a measure of control of your fugue states. When you suffer short-term or long-term madness, roll the d100 two times. You can choose which result to keep.

At 6th level, you gain a stronger, yet still shaky, grip of your sanity. When you suffer short-term madness, the duration is reduced to {@dice 2d4} rounds, and when you suffer long-term madness, the duration is reduced to {@dice 2d4} hours.
At 10th level, when you roll for the duration of madness, you treat the result of the d4 rolls as a 1.

subclassFeature.name: Unspeakable Arcana
entries: As you enter this pursuit at 3rd level, you gain the ability to extract arcane energy from eldritch sources at the cost of your sanity. You may cast a seeker spell using an already expended spell slot.
After you cast the spell, you immediately suffer short-term madness and you cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Maddening Exploit
entries: Starting at 6th level, your assaults can whittle your enemies' sanity. You gain the {@optfeature Unnerve|secretwizard} exploit.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Enlightenment
entries: At 10th level, you can open your consciousness to the whispers of beings from the great beyond. When you make a Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma check, you can choose to make it with advantage. However, after the check is made, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 6, you suffer long-term madness as the whispers overtake your mind.

subclassFeature.name: Gaze into the Abyss
entries: By 18th level, you've gained the ability to pour ineffable thoughts into the mind of a creature. As an action, you psychically assault a creature within 90 feet of you with an Intelligence score of 2 or higher. That creature must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@dice 8d8} psychic damage or half that amount on a successful save. On a failed save, the creature becomes insane for 1 minute, and can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish. Its movement is erratic. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can attempt another Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, it ends this effect.
After you use this ability, you suffer short-term madness, and cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Relic Hunter
entries: Some want the glory, some want the power, some want to uncover eldritch mysteries—but as a relic hunter, your goal is to retrieve artifacts and objects from the most dangerous locations. Coursing through cursed crypts, treacherous jungles, or fortified vaults, you have the toolset to evade danger and exploit the mystical abilities of forgotten relics.

subclassFeature.name: Tomb Raider
entries: As you enter this pursuit at 3rd level, you become adept in rushing past danger and use every resource at your advantage. You gain the following benefits:

items: You may use the {@action Dash} and {@action Use an Object} actions as a bonus action.
Opportunity attacks made against you are made with disadvantage.
When you make a running long jump, the distance you can cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Strength modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Evasive Exploit
entries: By 6th level, you learn how to seize the opportunity to escape your attackers. You gain the {@optfeature Tactical Roll|secretwizard} exploit.

subclassFeature.name: Object Reading
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can read the magical aura of an item to know more about its origins. By spending 1 minute performing an arcane investigation with an object, you may pry out certain information imprinted on it. The object must be within your reach while performing this ritual. The information you draw out from an object can only be about its creation or about events that transpired in its vicinity in the past 24 hours.
The information stored on objects about events can only relate to happenings that could be seen or heard within 20 feet of the object.

At DM's discretion, the object may also store information from other significant events around it. For example, a sword may store information about why it was broken, or about important creatures that were slain by it.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Item Talent
entries: At 10th level, your cunning allows you to exploit the hidden powers of artifacts. You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

subclassFeature.name: Reveral of Fortune
entries: Starting at 18th level, your luck allows you to perform stunning feats. When you roll a natural 1 on a d20 roll, you treat it as a natural 20.

subclassFeature.name: Secret Broker
entries: The market of knowledge is just like any other, ruled by supply and demand. As a secret broker, however, your job is to control both—ferreting the truth from the rumors, spreading misinformation, and prying confidential information. Armed with deceitful magic, your wits and your blade, you have all the resources to be successful in your clandestine trade.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Sleight of Hand} or {@skill Stealth}.

subclassFeature.name: Machinations
entries: As you enter this pursuit at 3rd level, how to subtly influence conflict. When you use the {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge}, {@action Help} or {@action Hide} action, you can then use any of those actions as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Insidious Exploit
entries: By 6th level, your attacks unnerve your foes. You gain the {@optfeature Agitate|secretwizard} exploit.

subclassFeature.name: Inscrutable
entries: At 10th level, creatures have disadvantage on contested Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma checks they make against you.

subclassFeature.name: Mint Memory
entries: Starting at 10th level, you have access to a special ritual that allow you to store a creature's memory into an object or show a stored memory to others. After spending 1 minute while a coin is within your reach, a willing creature may touch the object to store one of its memories into it, at the creature's choice. Even if the creature is uncertain about the full details of that memory, storing the memory this way imparts all the details as far as that creature was aware of at the time. An object can only store one memory at the time, and the memory cannot span a period of time longer than 1 hour. After a creature stores a memory this way, if the creature is willing, that creature may also erase that specific memory from its mind.

After this is done, you may select a command word. When a creature touches the object and speaks that word, that creature witnesses the memory as it was stored. This an immediate effect that takes no time.

subclassFeature.name: Shrouded in Mystery
entries: At 18th level, you become a riddle wrapped into an enigma. You are always under the effects of a {@spell mind blank} spell. If you attack a creature or cast a harmful spell against one, this effect is suppressed for 1 hour.
You can also use an action to voluntarily suppress this effect. If you suppress this effect this way, you can use an action to enable it again.
